captions.text:
There are things that have been taken 
from us and we want them back.
Let's talk about that.
♪ (theme music) ♪
Goooood Mythical Morning!

One of the inevitable parts of the human
experience as it is experienced in the

- modern world, Link and Mythical Beasts, 
- Mmhmm.

is that products come and products go. 
If you latch onto one of those products,

specifically a food 
product or a foodstuff,

- It's liable to be taken from you.
- It can be taken and it can have negative

effects on your life. We're gonna talk 
about some of the ones that we enjoyed

in the past that we would like to be 
brought back into the future--

or the present, really, but the future...
but it will be present when it's brought

- back and we're experiencing it. 
- Can I take you back to 1987 right now?

- Yes!
- The first thing that I wanna bring back

is the Hi-C juice box, the particular 
flavor known as Ecto Cooler.

Now, this is associated with the real 
Ghostbusters animated series in 1987.

- I recall that.
- It had Slimer on the box.

- It was like drinking Slimer!
- I never thought of it like that.

I thought it was what Slimer 
wanted me to drink.

It tasted so good. No, it was just-- 
you know, Slimer left slime everywhere...

- And if you wanted to drink some of that...
- They boxed it up.

They also sold it in a metal can. The 
interesting thing was, this was around

until 1997, so for ten years they sold
this Ecto Cooler, 'cause it was so good!

They didn't get rid of it in 2001. What 
they did was, they changed the name to

- Shoutin' Orange Tangergreen...?
- Oh, Tangergreen, yeah.

Tangergreen. So they got rid of Slimer but
they kept the thing. Then in 2006 they

- re-renamed it to Crazy Citrus Cooler.
- That's when I got into it.

- Then in 2007 they discontinued that. 
- They got crazy.

So bring it back all the way. 
Ghostbusters 3 is coming back.

I think there's gonna be-- it's a girl 
version. They could bring a girl Slimer

- and have an Ecto Cooler.
- Sure. I remember this specifically

being at your house and only drinking it 
at your house. But what I don't remember

at your house, which really surprises me, 
is the next thing on the list: PB Max.

The best way to re-introduce you to this 
is to show you the original commercial.
Okay.

(narrator) Just what is the "PB" in new 
PB Max? PB don't mean "Pineapple Beanie,"

"Pet Barracuda," or "Parachuting Buffalo."
PB don't mean "Prehistoric Barber" or

- "Pig Basketball."
- (Rhett, southern accent) Pig basketball.

(narrator) PB means "Peanut Butter." Lots of
real peanut butter and pure milk chocolate

- and the crunch of a whole-grain cookie.
- (Rhett) Yeah. Look at that, Link.

- It's got your name written all over it.
- (narrator) Now that's maximum satisfaction.

(narrator) Even if you're as mean 
as the Pottstown Barbarian, you'll be

- (narrator) pleased at one powerful bite. 
- (Link) The who?

- (Rhett) The Pottsdown Barbarian.
- (narrator) PB Max. We mean peanut butter.

- (Link) What?
- You know, the Pottstown Barbarian.

- I can't believe I never had that.
- That's my uncle doing that voice over.
(southern accent) I never saw that ad, too.

- Yeah.
- PB don't mean... this that and the other.

- (southern accent) Pet Barracuda.
- (laughs)

(normally) We had these. My 
mom would get these for us.

- Really?
- It was a-- sorry, I'm thinking about--

- You need me to--
- my pet barracuda and gettin'

- all choked up.
- (both laugh)

- I cannot believe that you didn't--
- I know!

partake in this, because this is like the 
peanut butter Snickers but even bigger!

I gotta have it back, man! It's just 
waiting to go into my mouth.

Please... back. Please... I'm 
trying to make "PB" be a...

- Please back the PB Max. 
- (laughs)

All right, I got another one here. 
Now, this was a cereal-- you know

- I'm a cereal lover. 
- Yep.

So kind of a snack, but kind of a cereal 
too. Introduced in 1984, the Mr. T Cereal.

- Watch this ad. 
- (Mr. T) I know cool, and cool is teamin'
up with a good balanced breakfast.

- ♪ Teamin' up with Mr. T Cereal ♪ 
- (Link) T's flying everywhere.

- Now, Mr. T's the one on the far left,
- Yeah, right.

- just so you know. 
- Those are his kids, right?

- (laughs) 
- His progeny?

(Mr. T voice) Look at all these kids 
I made with different women!

- (laughs) No.
- They all got different mothers!

He just flipped that girl. He's like a 
cheerleader. A shirtless cheerleader.

- (Mr. T) It's cool!
- ♪ Teamin' up with Mr. T! ♪

Yeah, but I really wanna 
know is: is it cool?

- Coo'. 
- And it's got a touch of brown sugar.

- Yeah it does. They said that.
- So I really gotta try this one out.

You gotta bring it back in order for 
that to happen. It's like Alpha-Bits

- but it's only T's. 
- And you eat it like this.

And then a mohawked man with feathers 
for earrings throws you in the air

- after every one, and you get cool!
- Now, I do remember this one.

You had it. I had it. We had it on the 
baseball field. A lot of people don't

- remember this one. Gatorade had a gum...
- Yes!
called Gatorgum.

(narrator) Active people are discovering 
the gum that's different! Now--

- You can lick (creaky voice) dryyy mouth.
- (Link) What? Eugh.

- (Rhett) It sounds like The Grudge. 
- (Link, creaky) Dryyyy...
(Rhett, creaky) Dryyyy mouuuuth.

(narrator) Its unique mouthwatering 
formula turns on the juice!

- (Link) It's raining on that gum!
- (narrator) So if--

- you wanna lick (creaky) dryyy mouuuth...
- (Link, creaky) Dryyyy...

- (narrator) Chew on a storm with Gatorgum!
- (thunder)
No drought about it!

- (thunder)
- (narrator) Gatorgum!

(Rhett) Aw, that's cute. 
"No drought about it." Listen--

- (creaky) Dryyyy mouuuuth...
- It tasted like chewing Gatorade,

- Yes!
- but it's false advertising.

Gum cannot help quench thirst. 
It's making your mouth produce spit

- (mocking) "It cannot quench thirst."
- that you're then swallowing.

- Yeah, it makes no sense.
- That's like saying, "I'm thirsty,

I'm gonna swallow my own 
spit to solve the problem.

- (laughs)
- That's why they discontinued it.

- But it tasted great!
- It tasted like Gatorade concentrate

- in your mouth.
- Yeah, well maybe we should just

- put that in our mouth with some taffy.
- (laughs)

Now, here's the last one. When I 
went down memory lane,

what came into my mind 
was Planters Cheez Balls.

They were discontinued in 2006. I didn't 
know they went away, but now that

I know that they're gone, I want 'em back.
You can get cheese balls from other places,

- But not Planters!
- but can you get cheese balls in

a container that (pop) pops off like that?
The cylindrical container that has

- You can't.
- Mr. Peanut on the front. It's like

- you're eating Mr. Peanut's cheese balls.
- (Rhett snorts) That's appetizing!

And of course they had
a very cheesy commercial.

- We're gonna have one terrific party!
- Not with these snacks.

Well, if you want something 
really delicious, have a ball!

- Huh?
- With Planters!

♪ For that crunchy, cheesier taste, 
have a ball with Planters Cheez Balls ♪
(narrator) Regular and new family size.

Now I'm having a ball!
♪ Nabisco ♪

Next up, we have a product that 
both of us were passionate about

- Still are.
- as children.

- Oh yeah. 
- It came out in 1987.

A sparkling fruit-flavored drink in 
an exquisite tear-shaped bottle called

- (unison) Clearly Canadian. 
- Now, here's the difference

- about this one, okay?
- Oh yeah.

We can actually bring this one back. 
If you watch Good Mythical More,

the show after the show, you may know 
that recently we were reminiscing about

the times we used to go down 
into sewers as children--

- that's something that we did, yes--
- Long story.

We started talking about the fact that we
would go to the Short Stop, the local

convenience store, and get these Clearly 
Canadian drinks during the hot

- North Carolina summers. 
- Yeah, it was a big treat.

- It wasn't like just getting a soft drink.
- It was a step above.

It was like, are we gonna get the 
blackberry Clearly Canadian today?

- Yeah. 
- That was so special.

And then we were like, you know what? 
Let's just go to the website--

'cause were telling the crew about it-- 
and we pull up the website and realize

- that they have a campaign going
- Yep.

right now where they have the tools 
in place to bring it back into production

- Right. 
- if enough people pre-order

- Clearly Canadian.
- I think there are over 9,000 cases

right now, but if they get to 25,000 cases
pre-sold, they're gonna then charge

everybody's credit cards and 
bring the product back.

So it kind of blew our mind that we were 
just reminiscing about it and then,

lo and behold, it's actually happening. 
We just talked about it.

You can see the moment as we 
realized in Good Mythical More.

Guys! Guys! This is crazy. Look! They 
aren't making it yet! "Help us bring back

the original Clearly Canadian 
by pre-ordering a case!"

- Ohh. 
- They gotta get to 25,000 cases

to bring it back and they're currently 
at 8,200. This is fate, guys!
What?!

- We post that a few weeks ago
- Right.

and then we hear from the CEO 
of Clearly Canadian. He contacts us.

Basically, we are now saying... he said, 
"I wanna commission you guys to get

the Mythical Beasts to bring this back." 
Because they've been doing the campaign

for a few months now and it's 
been moving pretty slowly, right?

- It needs an injection to get to 25,000.
- And we said, this is a great opportunity.

We did the Hashtag GMM War before on 
Twitter where we enlisted all you guys to

help us with that, and we think this is a 
fun thing just like that where we will be

able to say, as Mythical Beasts, that we 
actually brought a product from our

childhood back, and maybe your 
childhood too. If you're not familiar with

Clearly Canadian, you'll be able 
to taste it for the first time.

- Ask your parents about that.
- Oh yes. Your parents know about it.

So here's what we're asking you guys to 
do. To help bring back Clearly Canadian

for all of us, click on the link in the 
description which will take you to

ClearlyCanadian.com, and you 
can pre-order by the case.

- Right.
- So it's $30 a case. You get 12 of them.

Listen. It's worth it. Not just because 
you get to drink this product, but

because you get to say-- <i>we</i> get 
to say we helped bring it back.

Here's what we've decided to do: 
When we all have this thing

and we've met the goal and they've been 
shipped to us and we're holding the

- Clearly Canadian bottles in our hands...
- It won't look like this.

- It won't be in a mug, but...
- We are setting up a live streaming

video event where we're gonna all toast in
unison and drink them for the first time.

The new batch of Clearly Canadian. 
It'll be a Mythical Beast online meetup,

invitation only, if you've 
pledged to the account.

Right. The only way you get the 
invitation is by getting a case,

because you'll put your email 
address in when you get a case.

I think this is gonna be strangely 
satisfying. I think it's gonna show

the power of the internet, the 
power of the Mythical Beasts...

Let's bring back a 
freaking product, people!

Toast in unison across the globe? 
How crazy is that gonna be?

Use hashtag #ClearlyMythical in order to 
get your family and friends to contribute

to this thing. You know, team up! If you 
want half a case or something like that,

let's see what we can do. By the end of 
the year, if we can get the over 15,000

cases that are needed-- we need that 
many more to hit the 25,000 goal--

- Right.
- We're in this to make it happen.

- Let's do it.
- I think it's gonna be a lot of fun.

- Let's do it. Any questions?
- Uhh, when do we start, Link?

- Right now.
- Oh! Okay, good.

- We've already ordered our cases. 
- We have.

- We'll probably order some more.
- We'll probably order a few thousand more.

- (both laugh)
- We'll see if we have to make up

the difference. So, click the link in the 
description. We'll be talking about it on
Facebook and Twitter. This should be fun.

Thanks for helping out with bringing 
Clearly Canadian back and thanks for

- liking and commenting on this episode.
- You know what time it is.
Hi, my name is Alice and I'm from the UK.

And it's time to spin 
the Wheel of Mythicality!

Mythical Beasts, let's band together 
and bring back Clearly Canadian.

Hashtag #ClearlyMythical on the 
places where you use hashtags.

- You know where that is.
- Also click through to Good Mythical More.

We have even more foods that should be 
brought back. See if we can take you
further down memory lane.
(Rhett) Leaves about to fall from a tree.

- (silly voice) Sooooo, how goes it?
- (silly voice) Well, I got a couple of

- pit stains... wasn't expecting that!
- Oh, it's that time of the year, huh?

- Yep. I'm also turning yellow!
- Yeah, I can tell you're getting a little

- brownish almost.
- Yeah, and you're a little orange!

Oh, but I still got some greenish. 
I think you're gonna be first to go!

Okay! I'm gonna do it! Gimme-- tell me 
something. Gimme something that I can

take with me to the ground. Just give 
me something. Some encouragement.
Ah... nice knowing ya!
(crew laughs)

[Captioned by Caitrin:
GMM Captioning Team]

title: 6 Snacks That Should Be Brought Back
